topic.title: How to Add the Publication Audience to the Custom PDF Metadata

body.p: The audience element indicates the users the publication is addressing to. This can be placed inside a topicmeta element in a map like in the following example:<map> ... <topicmeta> ... <audience type="programmer" job="programming" experiencelevel="expert"/>
For collecting the type attribute, add in your customization css:

note.p: It is best to use the class selector, like *[class ~= "map/topicmeta"] instead of topicmeta in order to cover cases in which the elements are specialized, for instance in a bookmap the bookmeta is a topicmeta, so your selector will function also for bookmaps, not only simple maps.
The selector begins with map > to choose the topicmeta that is direct child of the map, not other topicmeta elements from other topicrefs.
